snippet: In a stunning about-face, Taishan Gypsum will pay $2.6 million in damages to seven Virginia families hurt by its drywall, after having fought any payout since 2010.
abstract: Chinese drywall manufacturerer Taishan Gypsum Company, which is state-controlled, agrees to pay damages owed to seven Virginia families, complying with 2010 judgement in federal court that found company liable; company had fought for years to avoid paying; agreement could pave way for class-action suit against company.
lead_paragraph: In a stunning about-face, Taishan Gypsum will pay $2.6 million in damages to seven Virginia families hurt by its drywall, after having fought any payout since 2010.

headline.main: Chinese Drywall Firm to Pay Damages
headline.print_headline: Chinese Drywall Firm to Pay Damages
